poem:
**Digital Divide**

In Michael's pocket, a mute rectangle,  
a silent stone beneath plastic sky.  
Refuses to whisper binary secrets,  
shuns the tick of algorithmic clocks.  
In the app-ruled realm, he stands  
outside the glass doors—  
a soul unscanned, unscanned,  
seeking truth in analogue echoes,  
holding steady in a river of code.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
